result.execSummary:
The defendant Destinee R. Link was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with Leon Ware, including for purposes of child care, unless agent pre-approves.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Attend and successfully complete anger management or domestic violence programming, if agent recommends.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1, 15CM236. Count 2 in 15CM236 and all charges in 15CM230 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Victim notification complied with.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of domestic CDTP.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.    Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with: L.W., unless agent pre-approves.  Pay restitution and surcharge.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    AODA and recommended treatment.  Anger management of DV programming agent recommends.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with: L.W., unless agent pre-approves, including purposes of child exchange.  Pay $230.00 in restitution and surcharge.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Anger management or DV programming agent recommends.    CC, domestic abuse surcharge, DNA sample and surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Have an agreement.  Set both cases for plea/sentencing.

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Willian Poss who appeared specially for Carly Sebion.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Case is not resolved and requests both cases be set for trial.  To be scheduled for 1-day trial and FPT.  Sent note to H.Z. to schedule.
